title: Apple's Swift Student Challenge 2024: New Category for Distinguished Winners
originSummary: Apple is launching the Swift Student Challenge in February 2024, giving students an opportunity to showcase their creativity and coding skills.
The challenge is open to students and focuses on using the Swift programming language.
Apple aims to support and acknowledge aspiring student developers, acknowledging the importance of coding in the future job market.
commentSummary: Apple's Swift Student Challenge is set to open in February 2024.
The challenge provides students an opportunity to demonstrate their coding skills using the Swift programming language.
Apple aims to support and acknowledge young aspiring developers through this challenge, with a new category recognizing 50 Distinguished Winners.

title: Apple to Launch 'Swift Student Challenge' in February 2024 with New Distinguished Winners Category
originSummary: Apple's Swift Student Challenge, a platform for students to demonstrate their coding abilities, will begin in February 2024.
The next challenge will include a new category for 50 Distinguished Winners, providing more opportunities for recognition.
Apple emphasizes the importance and benefits of coding education through surveys, educational resources, partnerships, and new Everyone Can Code Projects.
Winners of the Swift Student Challenge will receive a one-year membership to the Apple Developer Program, enabling further access to resources and support.
commentSummary: Apple's Swift Student Challenge, which allows students to demonstrate their coding skills, will open in February 2024.
The next challenge will introduce a new category for 50 Distinguished Winners.
Apple provides educational resources and partnerships to support coding education, as well as four new Everyone Can Code Projects for educators.

title: Apple Swift Student Challenge 2024: Create Coding Projects and Win Apple Developer Program Membership
originSummary: Apple is organizing the Swift Student Challenge in February 2024, where students are required to create coding projects using the Swift Playgrounds app.
Winners will be awarded the title of Distinguished Winners and will receive a one-year membership in the Apple Developer program.
The challenge is open to students aged 13 or older who meet specific eligibility criteria.
commentSummary: Apple will host its next Swift Student Challenge in February 2024, where students can showcase their coding projects using the Swift Playgrounds app.
Distinguished Winners of the challenge will be awarded a one-year membership in the Apple Developer program.
The challenge is open to students aged 13 and above who meet specific eligibility requirements.

title: Apple's Swift Student Challenge 2024: More Recognition for Creative Coders
originSummary: Apple's Swift Student Challenge, starting in February 2024, will introduce a new category that acknowledges 50 Distinguished Winners.
This challenge offers students a platform to demonstrate their creativity and enhance their coding and app development skills utilizing Swift.
A survey reveals that most students perceive coding as an essential skill, recognizing its significance for future employment prospects.
commentSummary: The Swift Student Challenge, organized by Apple, will begin in February 2024 and include a new category called Distinguished Winners, which will recognize 50 exceptional participants.
The challenge provides students with an opportunity to demonstrate their creativity and develop practical coding and app development skills using Swift.
A survey revealed that most students consider coding to be valuable for future job prospects and believe it is crucial to learn.

title: Apple Announces Schedule Change for Swift Student Challenge, Allowing More Preparation Time
originSummary: Apple has announced a schedule change for its Swift Student Challenge, providing students with advance notice and more time to prepare.
The coding competition using the Swift Playgrounds app will recognize 350 winners and 50 distinguished winners who will receive an invitation to visit Apple Park.
The 50 distinguished winners will be invited to Cupertino next summer, coinciding with the dates of the Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC), although further details have not been provided.
commentSummary: Apple has made a change to the schedule for its Swift Student Challenge, allowing students more time to prepare.
The challenge is a coding competition using the Swift Playgrounds app and will recognize 350 winners and 50 distinguished winners.

Winners will receive an invitation to visit Apple Park, a free one-year membership in the Apple Developer program, and 50 distinguished winners will be invited to Cupertino next summer, coinciding with the WWDC. Further details have not been provided.
